content.description:
An old project, this was recently bolted and is now one of the best lines at Higgy Land. A sequential crux leads to sustained pumpy climbing. A must do!

Left of 'Spark it up/Direct Tweakage', infront of the tree. Start up a broken system of ledges.
9 bolts

A bit mossy but better than it looks. Consistent climbing on edges. A short climb with an unprotected scramble to start - otherwise a good first lead.

From the base of Major Attitude in the Gappage zone (up the steep hill)  traverse along the edge of the wall on a narrow ledge. Clip in to the belay station. Right most route on the wall.
Bolts

Start behind Arbutus tree. After bolt 2, bolt 3 is directly above. After, it goes diagonal left, beside a 5.8. Climbs The left side of ‘Hig’s Zone Tower’. After bolt 3, going right is Prime Directive Right. A 50 m rope won’t cut it. But if that’s all u have and You are soloing, you can rap Off the anchor to viewers left down to the ledge and find more anchors or use a bolt down there. Uphill after a gully with a rope to the top (that scrambles up to anchors for Altitude and Hig’s Zone/Hig’s Tower). This is just up from Destruction Zone. Climb starts behind an arbutus. Between Hig’s Slown (aka Voyager) and Whatever   If you’re not tall, zig left on the start and come back right between bolts 1 & 2.
Good place for top rope soloing. Use the 1st bolt of PD Right as a directional.
On top rope, climbing out right onto the face beside the final bolt is the funnest finish.  Bolts

Same start as PD Left. After third bolt, branch right. Goes in the middle of this face to the centre anchor. Chains at the top.

Nail the tricky bottom without zigzag by getting right toe in the nubblies just below rock stain, left foot back-footed on the vertical spine. Right facing side pull. 
middle is a moss show scramble, but stay psyched! The top is rad!

Directional on bolt 5 for TR. 



Hig’s zone, starts behind the arbutus that might still have pink flag on it. 

Bolts

A direct line up the face, connecting to the end of Tweaky Face. Avoids the zig zag. A reachy crimp fest. Awesome line.

Start below an undercling block on not so obvious slanted crimps. Same as the direct start to Tweaky Face, but stay left and head up the blank looking face. Clips on your left.
7 Bolts. Meets Tweaky Face at 5th. Shared Anchor.

climbs.name: Tweaky Face (The new version)
climbs.fa: Kevan Robitaille (new) , old line Casey Richards (TR)

content.description:
Newly bolted after many holds had broken, the lower half sequence creates a very new line of great movement. Use a few long draws to make it easier to clean as it zig zags quite a bit.

Just left of the column. *Start up the jagged ramp to the right and traverse in left to clip the first bolt. A direct start on thin crimps into an undercling goes at 11.a and is a better, though harder start.
8 Bolts, long draws or slings advised for the 3rd and 4th bolts.

Nothing special, but long enough for a warm up. Start right of 'Whatever Pal' on the low angle face, follow bolts right, then immediately back left to continue up the arete to the top of the wall. Zig zags a bit.

Right of 'Whatever Pal'
Bolts

climbs.name: Whatever Pal (The new version)
climbs.fa: Unknown (Rob or Colin) Retro bolt FA by Kevan R

content.description:
Originally done on gear, it trended left at the diagonal cracks. A retro bolt has given it a direct straight line to the top of the wall. A fun warm up with varying movement, gear is decent. To the immediate right of Tweaky Face, right of the crack that splits the column.
Start up the face and clip a bolt, then use the crack under the roof, work on to the top of the column, and head straight up (stay right of the fern for the grade and best gear placements). 5 bolts. 3 cams (#1, .75, and #2 camalot will do) Shared anchors with Whatever. Originally done on gear, it trended left at the diagonal cracks. A retro bolt has given it a direct straight line to the top of the wall. A fun warm up with varying movement, gear is decent. To the immediate right of Tweaky Face, this route marks the border Hig's Zone and the Frayed End.
Start up the face and clip a bolt, then use the crack under the roof, work on to the top of the column, and head straight up (stay right of the fern for the grade and best gear placements). 5 bolts. 3 cams (#1, .75, and #2 camalot will do) Shared anchors with Whatever.

Just to the right of Paradise City. A bouldery, but well protected start leads to excellent moderate (5.9?) climbing. A relatively easy tick for the grade.



I can't remember exactly, but I think its 9 draws plus stuff for the anchors.
Up around the corner from the destruction zone is a low angle wall with a gully on the right. There are a few climbs up this low angle wall and on the vertical wall on its south side.
